intro: Sedum rubens subsp. andegavense, commonly known as the Andegavan rosebay, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, pink to red flowers. Native to parts of Europe, particularly the British Isles, it thrives in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant is typically low-growing, with a compact rosette structure that helps it retain moisture. It is well adapted to coastal and maritime climates, showing resistance to salt spray and strong winds.
